alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 9:56AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Light to moderate rainfall will keep river levels high along Chester Creek into this afternoon. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Chester Creek Basin and surrounding area. * WHEN...Until 345 PM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Light to moderate rainfall is maintaining high river levels and minor flooding along Chester Creek and in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 952 AM AKDT, NWS Employees reported that river levels along Chester Creek remained very high and threatened additional minor flooding. River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in addition to overflowing of poor drainage areas, especially near Chester Creek. - For Chester Creek at Arctic Blvd: At 9:15am the stage was 4.17 feet. Flood Stage is 4.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 4.6 feet is expected around 10:00am Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas. Obey any road closures and turn around don`t drown.
